lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've been awesome. Sam! You seem ready to say something?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys know what D&D Beyond is? It's awesome. You should check out the site dndbeyond.com. They also now have open alpha access for an upcoming mobile app. The D&D Beyond team is looking for additional stress testers and you can sign up using the following links. Insert links below me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In case they aren't--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I have to read it? Okay, bit.ly/dndios and bit.ly/dndandroid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bit.ly as in bit dot ly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, they know what bit.ly is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm just making sure!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) You got the perfect warlock, the weapons and supplies, But you need a place to track your stuff, 'cause you're so disorganized! You click open the web page you heard about on Critical Role. Now you're ready to kick some butt in that mineshaft full of gnolls! It's D&D! D&D Beyond. Yeah D&D! D&D Beyond. You got your stats, you got your sword and you've got your invisible wand! It's D&D! D&D (synthetic drum sound effects) D&D Beyond! (cheering and applause)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god! If they don't make that they're fools!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was magic!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to see that!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to make that right? We're going to make that now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are moments like this that it makes me a little sad that you're no longer a bard. At least we keep the Scanlan alive with shit like this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tell me you were singing that in your car on the way home from work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can see action figures busting through walls being held by hands (explosion sound effects).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was awesome. Thank you, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You had to imagine the synths.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, we were there. Thank you D&D Beyond for allowing that to happen as well as being a helpful tool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Les Mis was a stepping stone for that moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. Next up. Reminder guys who have Amazon Prime, with Twitch Prime, you can actually subscribe to a Twitch channel for free. One a month with your Amazon Prime account. If you have it, connect it to your Twitch account and you can subscribe to Geek & Sundry or any other Twitch channel you are a fan of, for free.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Mickey Mouse) Comes with Prime!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is going on? I'm so scared.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You hit a particular high note and we're trying to do our best squeaky voice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a really good idea to taunt the DM before you start playing. I think it works out really well for everyone involved.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like the internet, we like to obsess about your every little movement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Foster. Brian W. Foster. It's been a long day. W Foster!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very formal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Check that out. Laura, you said there's a merch update.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! Hey! I don't know if you guys have gone to the store lately but there's stuff in there. The reason that I was talking today is because I was informed that there's actually some more CR dice, not the Vox Machina dice-- those aren't back yet, but the CR dice are in stock if you've been wanting some of those. There's also stickers and keychains and t-shirts-- lots of t-shirts you should check them out-- and notebooks and awesome pencils.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still got that art book.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That art book and an apron for the Slayer's Cake.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just one apron.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A single apron, get it now before it's gone. Awesome, thank you, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Supplies are limited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I haven't seen it yet!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I haven't seen it in person yet!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all about the back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't open it! Your hands will touch it and it will no longer be mint! (groaning)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now it's worth more. Keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There'll be 1000 copies there. The limit is only five copies per person per day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my goodness gracious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're on the back of a comic book?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, and it's the Slayer's Cake apron that I was just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dark Horse is releasing that for this special event. Please check it out if you are going to be there. Grab a copy if you want. It is March 1st through the 4th, and our good cast members here Laura and Travis will be there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes we will as well as-- You're going to be there too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Speaking of the comic book: Issue five will be released on digital platforms of that very comic March 7th. Those that want to keep up and get to the next chapter of the six issue arc, issue five comes out March 7th so keep an eye out for that and we'll have announcements as that comes. You can look for a sneak peek at the artwork at geekandsundry.com. Once again, our campaign is pushing our fantastic friends at 826LA. They're an amazing charity group that takes underprivileged kids or children and young teens who don't have the opportunity to get in depth and learn about creative writing and give them a safe space for them. They do wonderful work. Check it out if you have the opportunity. See if you can give either financially or with your time and you can volunteer to be part of the program. It's really great. Other than that, appearances are as they've been and I think--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have one more thing. A quick shoutout to a critter named Carol who is an awesome fantasy writer and friend of the show. She's been feeling a little under the weather but she's been watching our new campaign and I wanted to wish her a speedy recovery and thanks for watching.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. The DM will remember that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we doing a show right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whimpering) Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grabbing your weapons and keeping your mettle about you, you charge further down the tunnel. The shaft curves to the right in a wide spiral about a few dozen-- there we go. What was that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The shaft curves to the right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said "The sha--" and she laughed. Like before you were done with the word shaft.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because the shaft curves to the right, y'all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's her psychic power.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's usually to the left, but whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Boom!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Too fast! Like a fencer! That was amazing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Walked into that one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Life or death. Here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The tunnel continues in a wide spiral before eventually snaking a bit-- (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're an asshole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were you going to say?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got it. We're with you. Life or death.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The path--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tables and stools are strewn about the area, with a pair of hyenas currently picking at junk for scraps. You see bits of meat that are being dragged across the ground by them about 20 feet off to the left. Two thick natural pillars of rock currently stand as load bearing portions of the chamber breaking the open space while a crumpled section of the floor drops into a pit below. Two closed doors, to the left of where you're looking into it, are guarded by a skeletal gnoll and two standard gnoll warriors, one of which has apparently pulled a small child from one of the doors. The sound of muffled cries coming from beyond the closed door. Four other gnolls rush from within the chamber into the right tunnel exiting on the opposite side. What do you guys do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four to the right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as four of them rush into the other exit. There's an exit to the left and an exit to the right. They exit the room to the right and then there's three left: two regular--

lines.name: MATT, TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Regular gnolls!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and then one skeletal gnoll and then two hyenas that are currently picking at scraps. You can see as the gnoll pulls the child out, is currently in the process of crying and they're both looking at each other like-- still holding the child by the arm essentially-- but currently is bickering with the other gnoll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From our vantage point, it is the entrance that we're at and then there is doors to the left--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me go ahead and give you a visual.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Visual aid, visual aid.

lines.name: LIAM, TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Visual aid, visual aid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! If this is like a running thing this whole campaign--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter) (Oohs and ahs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at that opening, it's so cool looking!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are entering from this side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh that's a little door? That's the door you we're talking about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's too many options!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, over here-- You can place yourselves as you feel necessary. Off to this side, in whichever marching order you prefer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will be at the rear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I figured as much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How old is the child that got pulled out of the room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At first glance, it's hard to see, especially for those of you who are keeping their light low, because there is no light source in the chamber. Those with dark vision will be making out most of the details here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be up front. I can do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that would put Fjord up at the front.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll be behind Fjord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't see shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, Caleb and Beauregard would not, because they don't see anything. You guys hear sounds, and you're waiting for any inclination of light to kick in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do we see, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys see the faint appearance of some sort of a flying creature, very small, emerge from the tunnel that had recently expelled all this dust and smoke.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Frumpkin size or smaller?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin size. (humming) It hovers in the air in a few places, and then locks itself over here onto this far wall, on a higher perch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking bugs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I saw that. Did you see that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (snarl) Another moment passes, and the gnolls relax. You watch as the immediate dread of the recent explosion sound, the shocking and rocking of the room, seems to have passed over them. They both go back to paying attention to their recent vicinity, which includes the small child, which is still quietly sobbing in the painful grasp of this large curled gnoll hand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On the count of three?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, are we just going to attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should distract them--!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Radiant blast!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Jesus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sacred Flame, I mean.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The ones who are making the initial strike on this--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could distract them or something first!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eldritch Blast for me, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will also do that as well, following suit with everybody.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, are things happening?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't hit the kid!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't see! Do you have your lights?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you don't see anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ones who can see in the dark right now, which would be the four of you, you guys get a round of attack on this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where you're currently positioned, I would like you all to roll initiative before we get to your round, just so we have it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, first roll of the night! Be fucking amazing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not so much?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've had better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not drunk anymore, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's worn off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Great. How about Nott?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 20 to 15.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you can't see, Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's missing the initial round.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this is for the whole thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. This is just general combat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If I'd have known that, I would have rolled better for the whole thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true. Sorry about that. That's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wasn't trying so hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very adequate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have rolled a nine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be the thing for the entire campaign. This is going to be the joke that never goes away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) Regular gnoll, regular gnoll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, oh no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's it. Just nine and regular gnoll, that's all that we have. That's campaign two, ladies and gentlemen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That leaves-- you rolled a what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: An eight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nines and gnolls. That's our group name, you guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No! Don't joke, don't ever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's one of the best rolls you can make in the game. What is our initiative shit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, you're up first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, but I didn't see, and you guys decided to attack first. I will grace you going first if you prefer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to hold your turn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel the tension rising and you're like, I'll follow their lead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that mean I still get to move and shit when I do my move?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That means you're holding your action.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then I'll go now. Because they're more than 30 feet away, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You can see what's out there, you just don't notice the bird.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hand crossbow, it says 30/120. I've got to be within 30 to hit them without disadvantage, right? If I run out there, they'll see me and I won't be sneak attack anymore, right? How does this work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If they don't know you're there, which this is currently what's considered an ambush round, you still have advantage on your first strike if they're not aware of your presence. Which means it would cancel out that disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can take my shot from here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I will fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! 17 plus a lot. Six! 17 plus six to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. You do not get sneak attack on this because you do not have advantage on the strike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought you just said I had advantage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had advantage, but you have disadvantage because they're beyond the--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It cancelled out your advantage. It's just a straight roll and you lost the sneak attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could I run forward and still get the sneak attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could try it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's what I will do. Undo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Roll again, because you might get natural 20!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now I have to roll for stealth, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been stealthed as you crept up on this from the last time, so go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm rolling to hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You already hit on that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Roll again for advantage, you might get a 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Still 17 plus six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you get a sneak attack, go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you find it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did! It was nowhere it should have been.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 11 points. Not very good rolls.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which one are you aiming at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not bad, either.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The one that's holding the child.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it's holding the child and it's looking down at the young boy, lifting it off the ground and bringing it towards its jaws as its teeth open wide, its lips curl back like it's ready to take a quick little nibble of the child's arm. Suddenly the bolt hits it in the side of the jaw and it's sticking out. (squeal, snarl) It starts looking over in your direction and it looks right towards you. (growl)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I use my regular-- regular gnoll. Do I have remaining movement as a bonus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bonus action you can dash if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. I will dash away, but I can't hide. I will dash behind those rocks to my right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. In those skulls or anywhere around there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That works fine there. Beau.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She can't see shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. Beau, you lose your turn. It's been a long day, I'm sorry. Molly, you're up next.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run straight in, take a look around. Is the undead one the closest one to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Push me a little more against the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, over there. I'm going to hit that undead one with Vicious Mockery. Actually, I'm going to hit the one that has the kid with Vicious Mockery, not the undead one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Same roll, puts him at a two, natural roll, so he's affected by it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh that's right, I don't have to roll to hit. Just a wisdom saving throw. That's three points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and he has disadvantage on his next attack roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. (rasping) Drop the child!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jesus Christ.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Get used to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems to hear it and there's something about the speech and the connection to this entity that cause it to shudder for a moment. That ends your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep. I'm holding waiting for them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next up is Beau. Wait, no. Sorry. That's my problem, I wrote Beau twice on this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm the only other one that can see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm Beau number two!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester and then you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I lied! I am not going to do the Sacred Flame, I'm going to do Toll the Dead because that's a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! Toll the Dead to which one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the one holding the kid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Constitution saving throw?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to put him at a 15.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, he saves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. As it seems to ring within its head, the impact of the necromantic magic, currently still reeling from the pain in the throat from the bolt, it seems to shrug it off, unaffected. Then Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (rasping) Next time I'm going to really hurt you! I said that in Infernal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which one of them is the undead looking gnoll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That guy. I would like to aim at the dude on the right, the one closest to you, and I will carry over my Hex that is still up since it lasts an hour, so for my bonus action I will cast Hex on that motherfuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to use Eldritch Blast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Roll for the attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus six, that's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. This is a 1d10 plus four. That's 11 plus five points of necrotic damage for 16 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Spindly, what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If I can have you roll initiative when you get settled in there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, man, I don't even know what that means!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got to see this dice as you roll it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want a dice tray, Khary? We have an extra one down here.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Oh my goodness, look at this!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look at that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The luxurious life.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome, friend! Welcome!

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: This is the first time this dice has been rolled, ladies and gentlemen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a christening roll!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a one!

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: It's a one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Welcome! Welcome!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One of us! One of us! [laughing]

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Thanks for having me, guys. I'll just be taking this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Storytelling!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You weren't even rolling those dice?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Yes. All right, here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, having succeeded at some of your other business, begin to creep further into these tunnels and suddenly see a cluster of unidentified individuals rushing in here and attacking these gnolls in front of you and the surprise of it apparently puts you off for the moment.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Just a little.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll come to you in just a moment. Good to know. At the top of the combat round, Nott, you're up first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was it? We cycled through a whole round of combat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The surprise round. The humans can't see anything, unfortunately. Everything you'll be doing will be at disadvantage after this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll have to move. I'll lean around to get around that stalagtite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Around here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, just so I can get an eyeline on the one I already shot once.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back over here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Anywhere. I'm going to move right back in a second. I'll lean around, reload. Oh, god! Fire again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I get sneak attack? No, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because you're not hidden.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shitballs. 20 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of damage. That'll do it, actually. As it's holding the child and lifting it up by the arm in the air, it looks like it's ready to run away and grab it with it. As it turns to flee, you catch it in the base of the skull and it falls to the ground. The child falls prone onto the floor next to the now lifeless gnoll body.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does the child look like? He or she? It's a boy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks to be a young boy, probably between six and eight years old. You're not quite sure of the age.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And human, I don't know anything about. Is it injured?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't got a strong bead on it but he looks to be humanoid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six or eight years old?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Around that age group, you'd assume.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some would say seven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! The field is ours now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! I'm too scared to go over there. No, there's a child in need. We've got to help.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're sober now, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Nott's going to scurry over to the boy as fast as she can scurry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30, and then you can use your bonus action to dash if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep, all the way to the little boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll do it. You can get right to the little boy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (screech)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [laughing]

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm good! I'm a good one! I'm good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [screaming]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now it's a horror movie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're hearing all these sounds, but you can't see anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to turn to Caleb and be like: Can you do the thing? The lights?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get back to me in a second, in about nine seconds.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to wait until he casts Dancing Lights.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't move in there if you hold your action, but you can move in and then hold your action if you want to. You're just not quite sure where you're walking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Sure. I will stumble forward. I will head towards Molly because I'm going to follow his fluorescent purple coat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just doing this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly! Molly!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's easy to see because Molly has this faint, luminous glow around the sword from his right. You see that as a beacon. You're like, "That I know, that I can follow." You cozy up right next to Molly and carefully prepare yourself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What action are you holding? If any.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I-- Because I moved and I'm not near anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I'll take the Dodge action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Dodge action. You're just being careful. All right, ending Beau's turn, Molly, you're up again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to rush the undead one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Spinning swords at bloody high speed and take two shots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Do you want to be on the higher ground here or--?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh! Can I do the higher ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll do the higher ground. That's exciting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now taking the stage, it's Mollymauk!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That sucks! I'm taking your--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was trying to help!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And your off-hand?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 does hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. Yep. No. That's at least eight points of damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's great!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's okay. That's okay. I'm now engaged in combat with him, so that's fine. I am whirling dervish that hits nothing at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As per usual.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a hippie with poi right now. Might as well be a pair of pois. Wah! Wah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to know. End of Molly's turn, Jester, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Okay. I'm going to move forward into the room. To about, yeah, there's good, sure. I'm going to try it again. Did the guy up there get hurt at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he's been damaged, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes? Then I'm going to cast Toll the Dead at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That is a 14.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fucking A, piece of shit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the save?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's 13 because I'm lame!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. As you try and release the energy once more, it can't quite get a bead on the gnoll's head. It's moving around and dodging and you can't focus on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to start unsnapping my sickle to get it out to hit things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you're fussing with this side, that's the end of your turn. All right. Caleb, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I cannot see anything, so I cast Dancing Lights. I put one above my head and as soon as I get a little bit of light, I send one over Beau's head and then I send one about 20 feet beyond Beau and then the fourth one, even beyond that one so there's a line of four lights because I don't know what the chamber is shaped like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The chamber erupts into bright light like there's four torches now lifting brightly at the entire space.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah, god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (exclamations of excitement)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where is he?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, Matthew, the guiding lights, those little '"foomphs" of light, they only have a 10-foot radius, so probably the edges of the line that I have cast just barely makes it flame.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're like market lights so it's pretty. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course. It is, of course, pretty. Never mind, just continue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. So.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: The thing you probably notice about me, first of all--

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (high-pitched) Ooh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. You can't have a better accent than all of us.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: --is my hair. My billowy, white afro.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Fingers of curly hair radiating in all directions. That should be the thing that you notice first about me but that's not it. It's my eyes. My eyes, as white as my hair. My pupil-less eyes as white as my hair. As white as the hair dripping down from my chin to a straight point about three or four inches below. I think that's all you really notice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, do you wish to move?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm in love. What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, do you wish to move?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Fuck that. I will stay where I am. No, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Fjord and the gnoll going at the same time. What are you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eldritch Blast again at that motherfuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 16 plus six, so 22?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight plus four is 12 plus four points of necrotic for 16 total points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The reason it misses is right as it swings towards you, Fjord raises the back of the sword and fires a blast of eldritch energy that hits the back of the gnoll's shoulder as it tries to spin and strike you. As it does, it goes wide. It pirouettes on its foot and stumbles back into the open hole. (high-pitched yell)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, there's an open fucking hole?! That's good to know! Oh, shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you hear the sound go (high-pitched yell)? So it's not ten feet, it's big.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Good to know! Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're a ways away. It's hard to see.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Uh-huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Described your initial description of the room, though, so now you know. As you, who has not given your name yet, but you turn around and see this gnoll as it looks towards you. It's leaning towards-- normally, it would be seven-foot, but it's hunched and wounded and as it turns down, it snarls. Takes its spear and attempts to pin you to the wall a bit. That's going to be a 12. What's your armor class?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: My armor class is-- what is it? It's 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? It does not hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one is going to run up alongside and attack Molly. This one is going to rush over to Nott.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Attacking Molly, that's going to be a 16 to hit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It's going to be--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dance harder, dance harder!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --two points of piercing damage. As it snaps up and bites the edge of your foot, you have to kick and shake it off on the rocks to get it to let go. The one that's striking towards you, Nott, that's going to be an 18 to hit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hits!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets one little bite on the side of your elbow and you immediately pull away and kick it instinctually in the chin, going (yelps). The kid is now freaking out of his mind as now there's, from his perspective, two snarling beasts cornering in. That's going to end the hyenas' turn. All right. Your go.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I would say, if this thing is this close to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's right up against you.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: It's right up against me. I think I should push him away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you feel the need, yeah.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Let's see. Thunderwave?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Certainly!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Skadoosh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that a wisdom saving throw or constitution--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a constitution save.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: That is a constitution save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a three. A natural two plus, actually plus zero. So two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah, that fails.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that fails.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your spellcasting modifier--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He rolled a two, you're fine.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: 15. It failed. Ah. Well, great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13, I believe. All right, cool. Go ahead and roll the damage of that.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: With this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it should say it on the spell there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it's 2d8?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's good!

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Five and seven?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 12. Damn!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of damage! As you turn towards it, describe what you do with your spell as the gnoll pulls back with its spear.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I take my reed of a wand and whip it. Three times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whipping sounds) As the third one hits, there's a burst of energy forward. You watch as the gnoll gets blown back, slamming into the stone wall and falls back to its knees before getting itself up. It was previously wounded, now it's on death's door. It looks like it's starting to hobble and try and flee.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you say you whip your reed back and forth? You whip your reed back and forth?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I do. I whip my reed. I whip my reed back and forth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you wish to move?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I do. I wish to move away from this gentleman that I just knocked against a wall and how about we take a perch on top of-- there we go, baby.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, look at that fucking miniature!

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: So cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes your turn. At the top, Nott, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I've got this thing on my arm? So with my other hand, I will (high-pitched whimpering) grab its face (normal voice) and I will say a few a words that Caleb told me and cast Shocking Grasp on it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! What is the spell save on that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit, how do I find out? You click on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it's a spell melee attack. So go and roll--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You try and reach out, but the snout is too slobbery and your hand slips off of it and it discharges the spell having no effect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (yelps)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yips)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's see here. I've still got some bonus-y stuff. Can I disengage? No, because--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'll disengage, grab the boy, and try to lead him behind the-- there's an overturned table?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is an overturned table. Yeah, these are overturned tables over here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will the hyena get a bite on the kid?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll find out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you drag the child away, while you've disengaged, you pull the child out of the range of the hyena and it sees the opening and snaps out towards--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Children have no hit points!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sure this one is hardy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) Careful, the kids you pull.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Hyenas will bite them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank god it wasn't me this time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn, Nott. Beau, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, seeing the situation that Nott is in, I'm going to immediately run over and attack that hyena.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Putting you there easy enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just going to run up and go, "Yeah, get!" Go kick and just kick it real hard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: G-I-T.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Git!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll some damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I use my staff as a little bit like a jumping leverage point to give me a little bit of momentum and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mini pole-vaulting?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. What do I do? I roll 1d8 and then double it. That sucks, but that's six plus four, so ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's enough to do it. As you kick, the hyena gets launched and arc through the air, slamming into this table which busts it up against the wall onto its side and you can't even see the lifeless body of the hyena. It's currently buried beneath the overturned table. That's your first--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a bonus action to use my med kit on the kid? My healer's kit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an action to use a healer's kit, unfortunately. You still have some movement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll just move over to the kid and hold the wound.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stem the flow?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you get down with Nott at this point and you're trying to think of some way to apply pressure to prevent the bleeding. Okay, that ends your turn. That brings us to Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm taking a roll at the big guy. First strike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, I forgot to put the undead guy on the initiative order which he would have gotten a round. We'll say you and him go simultaneously at this point since you engaged him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine because that's a 19 to hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a 13 to hit you. What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, even as it goes to strike at you with some sort of rusted battleaxe, you still manage to lift your foot out of the way and strike down towards it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is with the good sword, so this-- ooh, so this is (counting) 13 points of damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's adding your wisdom modifier?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's adding my wisdom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it attempts to swing towards you with the axe, you duck out of the way, spin around, and backhand it with your right enchanted scimitar, watching the bones (boom) explode and scatter across the ground. Like so many pebbles being thrown across the floor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With my off-hand, I'm going to take a swipe for the hyena over there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on. There we go! 20 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's good to dispatch two in one turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's nine points of damage. I would love to just kick that fucker right into the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets down and jumps to pounce towards you and you lean back and kick it and it tumbles down to the darkness below. You wish to move?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to move to the other side. I'm going to start running towards the stranger just to the left of-- yeah, I'm going to move towards that cover right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, the other way. Towards me. Right there, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gotcha. That ends your go, Molly. That brings us to Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Did I see the child go down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would've, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Then I am going to run over to the kid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just kill-- the kid's gonna live.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, all these other people are helping this kid, so I guess I will too. Somebody better kill that big gnoll, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you really care about the kid?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then don't help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't care but now I feel guilty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to healer's kit, Cure Wounds, what are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I use my last spell on this kid?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hells no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use a healer's kit to stabilize him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have to make a check for that. You get down and start pulling heavy rolls of soft cotton fabric and various balms to help treat the wound, and help staunch the flow of blood and bind the child to the point where it's no longer on death's door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The whole time I'm grumbling like: Oh I could have gotten that last Toll of the Dead! It would have heard a really good bell and instead I'm doing

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect, that ends Jester's turn. Caleb, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Angry healing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I cannot see anything except for Fjord, so if I move forward up to where he is, am I able to see any gnolls or any other kind of baddies where I am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there you can barely see the one across the way that's on the ground getting up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The call before it was clutch!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got to get you glasses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, Caleb needs glasses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb needs glasses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have them, they're right here!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends Caleb's turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A new prescription!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boomp!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gnoll's been wounded. It is going to take a--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Glasses make you smarter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's going to take a longbow off its and looking over and seeing the Fire Bolt that almost struck it, it's going to spin back towards you and pull and arrow. It's going to take a shot at you from across the way, Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one remaining wounded gnoll is going to take a shot at you with its longbow. Just checking real fast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your scarf will protect you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, sure! You're well within its first range increment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a very high AC. It's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: However nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Unload it, give it to me!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's trying to find a positive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, don't find a positive!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That could have been a lot worse!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's pretty bad for him, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, actually that hurts an awful lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gnoll released the arrow. As it hits you in the stomach, it comes piercing out the other side, pinning your jacket to you torso. You feel like the pain and the warm pulse up your back from the wound. It's almost numb at first and then you feel the shock hit you as the gnoll turns and runs this way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! I should have Tolled the Dead on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to ends the gnoll's turn while you're going Fjord. Because you're going in the same round as this is happening, so you technically could intercept.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to get line of sight on him. I look back at Caleb with his failed attempts and say: Let me try mine. I'll move my Hex over to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Hex is on him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll fire an Eldritch Blast in his direction. That is only a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A 16? 16 hits, actually. You needed a 15 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four plus four, eight. Plus three points of necrotic for 11 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Holding your sword out, another burst of eldritch energy smacks into the back of the gnoll. You hear (screeches) as it falls to the ground and slow bits of curling green and blue eldritch flame begin to burn and consume the corpse before eventually it goes out, leaving most of the body intact. Its back shoulder blades now a black cave where its body once was.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You ganked him at the last second?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Someone bring me those ears and bring them to my jar!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That being the case, the combat has come to an end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many gnolls was that we just killed?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well don't we send a lot of them down the hole. We didn't get their ears. So bad job.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We only sent one down the hole.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got two ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. They're sets of ears. There's the one there and then the one that was killed there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right and then, one hyena set.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I appreciate you all counting ears, but can we deal with the kid for a minute?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He needs some help!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you see what I'm doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who are you?! Ah! Who are you?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Who am I? My name is Shakäste. Nice to meet you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (swooning) He said Shakäste.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: You can thank my bird for knowing what you look like, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I saw your bird!

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: That's not just some bird. That's the Grand Duchess Anastasia Nikolaevna. They call her Stacy, but that's not her name.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) The Grand Duchess.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: The Grand Duchess. She's a sweetheart, but she's angry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is very dark in here, what kind of bird is that you have?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Oh, that would be an abrahum. That's a dark, midnight hummingbird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, you're a badass, what's your deal?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Well, right now my deal it to deal with this little person over here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, handle this child, but then we're very curious to ask a couple-- I'll shut up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you heal? Do you have healing? Because I'm stabilizing him don't worry, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He doesn't look good.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I think I can maybe do something about that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perhaps. The child is wounded, but the child's wounds have been tended to. He's unconscious, but is no longer in immediate danger of dying. He'll eventually need rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And some doughnuts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perhaps some doughnuts.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take one and push it onto his face.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no! Fresh doughnuts! You know do no harm, all that shit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you do anything to help this guy?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Well he seemed to be stabilized. I think the best thing we could do is to get him to safety.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I agree. What were you doing down here? We ourselves were comin' down trying to rescue folks.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I tend to look over the people who happen to be around here. I come by every once in a while. I used to live and grew up in this place, or in the valley not too far from here. Probably just like you, I heard a commotion. I've taken a few of these people to safety. I've been trying to do it less overtly than some of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We do make a bit of a clatter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're working on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Insight check! [laughter] 11 plus, what am I adding? 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. He's generally pretty forthright in speech, charismatic figure, you don't get any sense of any immediate lying or conflict to the words he's saying. You're also not getting a full read, either.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How handsome is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Quite handsome. If you'd like to describe how handsome you are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, what do you look like?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I would say I'm an old--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On a scale from one to ten.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: On a scale from one to ten, I would call him striking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bachelorette finalist? [laughter]

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: You know what? I think he's old enough that he's gotten past all the bachelor-ing and the bachelorette-ing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you a gray fox, is that what you are?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I mean, he's a striking character. He's got three dimples, one you can't see. Two are pretty deep in his face and can be menacing, unless he's smiling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you wearing?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: He's covered in leather straps that are a tangle of brown and red and green that pretty much cover him from his neck to his calf where his boots start to take over. There's a hood that he's wearing, deep green. It goes down to his legs and a big enough hood that's able to cover his ample locks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Meanwhile everyone is talking to this stranger, I'm going to edge up to this hole in the ground and hold onto rocks because I'm scared to death. Look over and send my globules of light down there to see if it's a deep hole, if it goes a long way, what am I looking at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently ends into rocks and rubble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a poop hole!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the broken body of a gnoll and the broken body of a hyena down at the bottom of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have to get this gnoll out of the bottom of this hole because that's gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's probably covered in really old poop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's still good for the monetary value that was laid out for us, so maybe on the way out we could send-- We have a rope we could lower you down and you could slice it off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I could down there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not right now, save it for a rainy day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shakäste, my name is Fjord. We are, like I said, on a rescue mission. Are you familiar with these tunnels, at all? Have you been down here before?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Have I been down here before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The most you've been down was the opposite side of this tunnel here. There was a group up here where you had been working with previously, but only recently decided to delve deeper once you had made sure that those few were safe.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Right, right. Well, I've done a pretty good job of taking care of the other tentacle of this cavern, I guess you'd say.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shaft.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Yes, the shaft. That's a good way of putting it. That boom you may have heard happened to come from me, so we've got a little bit less to have to deal with. This, I really don't know what's going on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, speaking of, I stand up and I walk to the door where the little kid was pulled from.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, Nott, do you want to let her take a look at it? In case it could blow up on you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've seen their traps. I know their methods!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any ropes across the door?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let me look! Are there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five. Plus five is ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can tell, it doesn't appear to be trapped. It does have a simple latch that is only accessible from the outer side, but it is not locked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I knock on the door. Housekeeping! Is anybody locked in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A moment passes. There's no response, but you hear the faint sniffing and whimpering of somebody on the other side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's the mom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's open the door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. (turning noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks to be human. She's currently huddled with her knees to her chest and there's tear streaks down her face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the, is the-- Oh, sorry, go on.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Can I walk to her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. As you open the door you watch as Shakäste begins to approach and take the space.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I look her in the eye. I put my hand on her chin, so that she looks me in the eye, and I tell her, shh. What does that make her feel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you."

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: We need to get her out of here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Definitely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit, this guy's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He is. Smooth operator.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I ask the woman, is this your child?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She turns around, and she goes, "Oh my god!" She runs over to him and immediately picks him up into her arms and begins to hold him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's alive, don't worry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (crying) "Thank you. Thank you." She's rocking the child in her arms, quietly rubbing his face and wiping a bit of blood off of his cheeks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any other people that are alive that you know of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are a few. I haven't seen, but I've heard voices across the way, and they took a number deeper in, before they locked me in."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Can we run over to the other door?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nonchalantly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks as disheveled as the woman you just uncovered.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he's alive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's alive.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a personal question. Is there anyone alive in here right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm the only one."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! Well, we'll take it. I'm swinging the door open and coming in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get up, and you can see now, there's a large claw gash across his midsection that might be infected.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you wait a second, it's only getting better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who are you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that is a question. We're here to help. Come on out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're the rescue party.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anyone else that you were with that's no longer with us in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean--" He points back and says, "I don't know most of these folks, I was just passing through. We were bringing some of our armor-wares up to Zadash when we were waylaid on the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You didn't get taken from Alfield?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, we were taken on the way to Alfield. We were almost there. They hit us right as they were reaching the city. We had no chance."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got hit on the way to the city, not in the raid on the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We were just arriving in Alfield when it hit."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bad timing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're telling me."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get you out here, for a second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The woman has come up once again to--

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I have a place for these people to go. It's up on the surface.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're safe there?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: They will be safe there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a cart to get them back to Alfield?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Well, a cart was just the thing I was needing. What say we hang out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All of us together, like a big party?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I've got nothing else to do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So many new friends lately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am concerned that there are more further on in these tunnels, but I think you're right, we won't be of any use to these people if we don't get them to safety first.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far was that tunnel to the surface? We cleared out this side.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Have we lost our way from- or at least the way that I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That tunnel's not operational.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: That tunnel's not operational. We've got two ways out here, I see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have this way, which appears to go deeper into the mine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, not that way, nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This way, which backtracks where you guys come from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we need to escort them or can we send them up to the surface?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know what we could do? If we want to check this cave for more people, is that we could bring them up to the cart and I could do that one spell that I have that would let me know down here if anything is happening up there--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. If the little bell goes off in my head then I know that either that something's coming out--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The good bell, not the bad bell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The good kind,

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long is it going to take to hike back the way we came?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not too long, maybe 20 or so minutes back to the surface.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: That's not bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to leave some folks down here to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if they repopulate all of these rooms that we've already cleared?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should move together. There's no point in leaving just a few--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you leave your alarm up here--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I was thinking about getting them to safety outside. If anything leaves the mine, we'll know it was them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair then, yeah. That's a good plan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't like this plan at all. What if someone-- What if one of the gnolls wanders into this room and sees five of his dead brothers?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's throw them down the hole!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We start kicking them right up to the edge, kicking them right in the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One after another, you take the remainders of the previous battle and roll them into the hole in the center.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now they all look like they just left and had some--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a whole other room with dead bodies in it that we also caused, and also ball bearings.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, people die all the time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, sometimes accidents happen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll be coming right back down. We just need to get them to safety.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, people don't bare balls all the time, but I think it's a reasonable risk at this point in time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus, we could take a short rest up top while we're getting them folks to safety.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like this plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any other boxes or things to search down here before we get out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can search if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, let's search around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my God. I crack boxes like fucking Zelda.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quietly, maybe?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Quiet, sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many dead bodies do you think I could carry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could drag two.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take a couple as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're pretty strong, you could drag two bodies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try to drag some of the dead out--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody else can take one each, I think, based on your strengths. You can take none.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Yeah, my dragging days are over.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to look around, see if there's anything of interest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so two of you can make investigation checks on this one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will help you look because I have an eye--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need glasses though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I have very-- trust me, I mean I could roll for shit but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's nearsighted.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh nearsighted, I understand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But you have advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I have advantage?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because he's assisting you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If he's assisting you, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's 15. You know, for level three.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (chanting) Level three. Level three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In a quick glance through, a lot of it appears to be pickaxes, shovels. Most in here seems to be tools and anything of worth has been ravaged or taken. You find a few bits of rotted meat of indeterminate origin, that you immediately shrink away from.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, actually, I'm going to scoop up some of those pieces of rotted meat and put them in my pockets.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. There you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can't smell it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it smells good to me!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could be good bait later.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's why I'm taking it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Any baubles or little doodads?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing in this chamber, unfortunately. This one has either been picked clean or didn't contain anything of immediate worth in the process.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I don't care about worth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there are plenty of bodies you could rummage through if you wanted to, but.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As we're walking them, Nott's going through the pockets.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Anything explosive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make an investigation check, if you'd like.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: All right. How would I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20 and add your investigation skill bonus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's there by-- good roll.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Plus one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, 15 for him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 as well. All right, so. Not in this chamber in particular, but as you guys are going through the other tunnel, you glance over in one of the overturned boxes and you find another familiar object, one of which you had used previously. Another singular stick with a long explosive wick on the end. You have another piece with you.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Gingerly, I take it up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those can make big booms.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: This ain't my first rodeo, baby. Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (flustered noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he says that and turns, you watch as the small black hummingbird perches on his shoulder as he continues to walk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's got a Frumpkin too!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm dragging the bodies going, Duchess! Duchess Stacy, please come over to me! Duchess Stacy!

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Grand Duchess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grand Duchess Stacy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We make our way back up to the top.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll have you all-- You can't make stealth checks. You're dragging bodies. Who's carrying; how many bodies are you bringing back?

lines.name: TALIESIN, TRAVIS, LIAM, MARISHA, MATT
lines.text: One.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's four, five, six, seven.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will go ahead of the party to run point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goes, "Mom?" She goes, "Shh! It's okay; it's okay." She looks up over towards Shakäste, and has more tears in her eyes, and goes, "Thank you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I helped too!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I stabilized him. I stabilized him real good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you all so much." You lead them over through the hills here, that cluster around where this mine once was, around the corner there appears to be a shed that's been long abandoned and locked up. As you approach, you have been here previously.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I take my reed stick and rap on the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is that you?"

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Shh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door opens and there you can see emerging four survivors, also from Alfield that, with bright eyes, welcome the arrival of this strange traveler, as well as the three other survivors you've brought in. As some of them begin to reunite with people that are familiar to them, people who live in Alfield and know each other, they begin to hold each other and take a moment to relish in this renewed moment of life. Then they begin to pour over the bodies that have been recovered, and they begin to identify them to each other, and then sadness takes over. Then once those waves have passed, individuals begin to go up and thank you, and take your hand, and a few of them are like, "Anything I can give you, please, just let me know. Thank you so much." It's a lot, to have at once, and for many of you an experience that is different and new. Take it as you will, however you wish to, but you also know time is of the essence, and not too much time can be spent on this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would say that I did not partake in any of that. As soon as we exited efficiently, I pulled out the silver thread and I'm already doing my thing while they do that.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I would say, to the people inside: Stay safe, stay here. I look at everyone else and say: this isn't over.

lines.name: MARISHA, KHARY
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a badass motherfucker, I'm just saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I'm so about it. He's so cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know. Number one fan club.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I guess we do not need a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the bodies are placed in a small pile and a large heavy piece of canvas material is placed over them to hide them. The shed is closed and locked, and they all seem to feel, at least for the moment, comfort and safety in this space, as you all begin to delve once more into the mines beneath the hills. I would like you all to make a stealth check, please, as you progress further in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh good. That's my specialty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, I could give someone a blessing, who's shitty at this? Blessing!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. Ugh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: What am I doing?

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Roll a 20.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Roll the 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With advantage?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You brought me from a four to a seven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Jesus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Universally, you guys are all confident in your ability to delve without being seen, even making up for those who maybe not have been a less bumbling experience making their way in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I stubbed my toe!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shh! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Learn how to see in the bloody dark!

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: You've got light, boy, you'll be fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way back through the familiar tunnel, and you can now see that the right tunnel, the one that you had previously seen the pitfall and decided to not head down into, is now a large cluster of rock and rubble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's where you came from?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Mm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You progress down through the ritual area, carefully avoiding a scattering of metallic ball bearings across the floor. You see an altar with candles on it that have all burned down entirely, except for a few tiny flickers. Is there any light source you guys are bringing down here with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (spell effect)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You head down into the familiar chamber where this last fray occurred, carefully avoiding the large hole in the ground. This is the only other exit from this chamber. You continue forward. Who's taking point, and what is the marching order, please?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep checking for traps, okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, that's a good idea.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Can I send the Grand Duchess?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not getting over that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, the Grand Duchess and Frumpkin will be best of friends.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they like each other?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin was obliterated.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: --stay away from my bird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, it's funny, because only about 30 minutes ago I also had a bird, but he was obliterated.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was very sad. I'll bring him back tomorrow.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He and I, we are like that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's going on, it's going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's very charming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we're seeing more of Caleb's social awkwardness, seeing him from the outside, it's so good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's everything I could've wanted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20, and add two to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's great. The tunnel descends at a moderate grade for about 80 to 100 feet before it levels off once more. Ahead, you see a set of rough stairs that rise for about five or six feet, leading to the remainder of the tunnel, and then curving to the left suddenly out of sight, slightly along this elevation. Right there, you have your bird (hovering hum), and right as the stairs ascend and turn immediately, there is the outer corner of a gnoll stands there waiting, keeping watch. (gnoll murmurs) Do you want to send your bird in further to check out the rest of the room or pull it back?

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: She's quick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's pretty quick.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: I say move on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. (hovering hum) Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really smart that he made a hummingbird. That's really fast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's really clever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a pretty smart move, don't you think?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not a cat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One that can see in the dark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, it's really smart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the Duchess moves further and up to the platform, the Duchess can see another portion of the floor that is collapsed inward into another falling pit that rests against the wall on the opposite side of where these stairs ascend. The tunnel curves to the left immediately, where this hole is on the top, and where it continues down there appears to be a large archway where there was once a set of double doors. The doors have been broken off the hinges and are not visible at current sight, but to each side of the frame, you can see two skeletal gnolls with bits of flesh and skin hanging off their bones and rib cage and snout, sitting there like silent undead sentinels looking around.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Thank you so much. Come back to me, dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (hovering hum) Charging back to the tunnel, back to your shoulder.

lines.name: KHARY
lines.text: Beyond him, there is more to deal with. I think we quietly take care of this gentleman first, and then we move on.
